name: Time Mysteries 2: The Ancient Spectres
description: Fulfill your destiny, become the ruler of time, and change the course of history!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8 Processor: 1.5 GHz Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 128 MB VRAM DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 1 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8 Processor: 2 GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 256 MB VRAM DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Second game of Time Mysteries Series. This time you are a girl raised alone try to discover her family's secret and the evil ancient specter that battled merlin long ago.   Another needle in the hay stack hidden object game with quite good graphics and sound. The small side puzzle game of this game are not that well explained some time. (Like the last water pipe puzzle. You have to not only connect point A to point B but also make sure there are no water leaking on open pipes.)  Still a very enjoyable game with interesting story, animation and wonderful voice acting.   Difficulty is a bit harder than the first game. Achievements are quite straight forward. I messed up on a few things so a quick replay should solve it and 100% in a few hours.   8.5/10... A must play game for hidden object lover and puzzle solver.
Another delightful hidden object / adventure game. Pleasantly challening with a good story. Encountered a couple bugs, but nothing major. Had a good time with this.
I enjoyed the game very much.

Solid HoG with above-average difficulty puzzles and a jolly time travelling mechanic.  Due to some very hard (for the genre) obstacles, it's not a great candidate for  Babby's First HoG . Other AM games like the  Nightmares from the Deep  series would be a better start.   Note: I don't have gameplay hours or achievements here as my experience with this game wasn't acquired playing it on this Steam account.

took everything from the 1st one and made it better. TONS of puzzles and minigames. also has a minigame alt for puzzles. Story was simple but interesting enough. Faces.... yea.... better than the 1st one, but that ladys face was creepy.

It is the year 1830, and a young governess named Ester has just received a letter that will change her life forever.         YouTube™ Video:  ➜ A Quick Look @ 'Time Mysteries 2: The Ancient Spectres' + 3 Steam keys to Giveaway! (ENDED)

Pretty nice game with a decent storyline. Decent voiceacting for the most part, nice graphics. You'll wonder where the rest of the story is though. One of the better HOGs that Artifex Mundi's put out with a few twists on familiar themes.

A great game, especially because of the time-travel aspect, but also the graphics are great, the characters' voices are very appropriate to the character, and the puzzles are interesting. Cannot stress enough how great the graphics are and how beautiful the scenery is in nearly every scene. Play it, it's so interesting!

A huge step up from the first game, but still not as good as the third one. The art and writing definitely went through strong evolution. Especially the main character is much more likable. The voice acting is much better but does still get a bit hammy here and there. It has a bonus story, which feels a bit random.  The minigames have still no description and I found myself skipping one or two when I couldn't figure out what the end result was supposed to be. I tend to loose interest in those cases.  All in all, watching Artifex Mundi mature as designers through this series was very interesting in itself.
It's somewhere among the lines of the first game: it just doesn't work well and I didn't enjoy it either. The third game is really what saved this series, which is not Artifex Mundi's forte.

I love Artifex Mundi games but this is not their greatest. I tried hard to summon the strength to finish but the game unfortunately got on my nerves.  Pros - The concept of time travelling to find and solve clues is great! - The artwork, as always, is good (not the best in this game but still looks nice) - The story seemed like it would be interesting from what I played so far.  Cons - The worst culprit by far is the female narrator. She drove me nuts! She narrates what is happening to her like she is reading the weather and it's going to be sunny all day. Not convincing at all and I couldn't even click through the narrative to shut her up (she really needs shutting up). - The HOS seemed too cluttered (yeah, I know they're supposed to be) to the point where I struggled sometimes to distinguish one shape from another. - The time travel tool gives you a ! which indicates an area you can explore/solve a clue next, but I got to the stage where there were no ! anywhere and for the life of me, I couldn't find the last item I needed to progress. I even consulted a Bigfish guide but gave up when I couldn't find a solution.  Sorry, Artifex Mundi. I love and have played most of your other games but this one is not your best.   Hala xxx  P.S. Please don't use the same female narrator again. She was awful :(

The time travel mechanic bogs this game down making it tiring and cumbersome and the story was weak as well. Not enough characters and events (practically none really) just several hours of yourself and a slog of puzzles culminating in a disappointing ending.

An underwhelming sequel to an underwhelming game featuring a frustrating amount of backtracking and at least one hidden object sequence that cannot be solved without using a hint or a walkthrough. Not terrible but not among Artifex Mundi's better games either.
